title: Olivia Torresan
text:
olivia is an interdisciplinary scientist, writer and artist from ngunnawal and ngambri country (canberra, “australia”).
their scientific work focuses on applied ecology; where they specialised in ornithology for a research thesis at the australian national university.
artistically, they enjoy exploring and archiving sound, photo and text.

Roger, E., Kellie, D., Slatyer, C., Brenton, P., Torresan, O., Wallis, E., Zerger, A. “Open access research infrastructures are critical for improving the accessibility and utility of citizen science: a case study of Australia’s national biodiversity infrastructure, the Atlas of Living Australia (ALA)”. title: Education
text:
Nesting Competition in Superb Parrots (Polytelis swainsonii) (Thesis) *
Australian National University 2023-2024
My thesis investigated the prospective impact of nest–hollow loss and competition from other species in the Superb parrot (Polytelis swainsonii) population in Canberra (ACT). Proficient in camera–trap set–up, monitoring and field identification of bird populations. Available on request.

Bachelor of Environment & Sustainability (BenSU) / Resource and Environmental Management (Hons.) *
Minor: Biodiversity Conservation
Australian National University 2017-2021
Theoretical and field experience in environmental assessment, Indigenous cultural and natural resource management, stakeholder engagement and consultation, statistical modelling, basic GIS analysis, ethical research practice, sustainable agriculture, environmental legislation and policy, as well as fire practice and management.

Bachelor of Arts / Philosophy
Minor: Sociology
Australian National University 2017-2021
Public policy, epistemology, ethics, philosophy of science, continental philosophy and gender studies.
